messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:07): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: so we've gotten multiple reports about validator error messages for src-less script elements being confusing/misleading
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:08): specifically, for the case where you have a script element with an inline script
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:08): that is, non-empty
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:08): but you have, e.g., a charset attribute on it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:28): strings over enums
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:28): it does make some sense
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:43): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: well, I suppose hacking Jing would be too hard
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:43): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: so I guess this needs to move to assertions.sch/Assertions.java :-(
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:43): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:43): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I think that's the easiest thing
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:43): I'm working on it now
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:52): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: please try <script defer>var foo;</script> or something at http://www.w3.org/html/check and let me know what you think
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:52): or async or charset
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:56): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: looks good
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:56): steps away for a bit
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:56): ah cool
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:56): I'll send you a patch to review
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:56): thanks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:56): wonders how to do printf debugging with X input drivers
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:57): maybe there's a function for dumping stuff in the X server log or something
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:12): http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/xml/uncomp/articleshow?msid=167551 gives me the YSoD (link from Hixie's anti-XSLT blog post from years ago)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:13): "non-xslt top-level element with null namespace uri"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:13): good times
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:14): "That is not possible. Developers would fix the mistake before it hits users."
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:18): Maybe the error message should read "Something impossible just happened. If you have any feedback on our handling of this issue, please contact <email/>"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:20): "Also, the author of this site is a bozo."

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:42): "and had several off-line meetings with the HTML5 chairs" -- http://www.w3.org/QA/2010/11/progress_in_lyon_-_tpac_2010.html -- such usage of "offline" always strikes me as weird

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:44): "One piece of advice from the AB was to support our current policy of having dues paid in three currencies; even as they advised that this should be reviewed on a regular basis."
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:47): You have to pay 1/3 in each currency?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:48): no, depends on which W3C host you're associated with
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:49): I just don't see how the above is advice
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:51): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: is trimming whitespace before comparing encoding names an HTML thing or a Web Platform thing?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:51): that is, should I fix it in the HTML parser or in Gecko's charset alias service?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:51): that is a good question
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:52): and I don't really know; guess it depends on what happens in XML
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:52): or you can maybe test it with charset=" ..." in HTTP, but Gecko had issues with quotes there...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:53): what about @charset in CSS?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:54): yeah
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:54): though I guess it ought to be tested in IE
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:54): and I don't have Windows yet so I cannot help
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: The case shifting for getAttribute et. al. should happen for any node in a HTML document, right?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:59): yes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:59): oh wait
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:59): So how does one deal with foreign content where the name is case shifted
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:59): only if the element is in the HTML namespace
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:59): rtfs instead
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:59): http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/domcore/raw-file/tip/Overview.html
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:59): Ah, somehow I missed the first clause
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:00): Sorry for being sumb
